predicate.note: Frames file for 're-enter' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class 51.1, other framed members are 'leave'. Also comparison with 'go in'.

example.name: place entered as NP
example.text: An ambitious expansion has left Magna with excess capacity and a heavy debt load as the automotive industry re-enters a downturn.

example.name: place entered as a PP
example.text: The two concerns said they re-entered into a definitive merger agreement under which Ratners will begin a tender offer for all of Weisfield's common shares for $57.50 each.
example.arg: a definitive merger agreement under which Ratners will begin a tender offer for all of Weisfield's common shares for $57.50 each

roleset.name: submit again, cause to enter again

example.name: submit, transitive
example.text: On Oct. 19, 1987, some investors learned the consequences of *trace* re-entering ``good-til-canceled limit orders'' and then forgetting about them.

example.name: including manner
example.text: A limit order to sell could be re-entered *trace* at that price .

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: And even when a specific order is acceptable to an exchange, a brokerage firm can refuse *trace* to re-enter it for a customer.

example.name: dunno why Arg2 didn't show up
example.text: John re-entered his crayon drawings into an art competition.
